messages.content: ComfyUI-SaveAsScript is a fork of ComfyUI-To-Python-Extension that provides a more robust command-line interface and the ability to export your current workflow as a script directly from a button on the ComfyUI web interface.
What new feature does ComfyUI-SaveAsScript provide?
ComfyUI-SaveAsScript provides a new feature called Module Support, which allows exported scripts to be imported as modules.
How can the exported script be used?
The exported script can be run to execute the workflow without a frontend, or it can be imported and the main() function can be used to call the workflow programmatically.
What is the purpose of the 'Save as Script' button on the ComfyUI web interface?
The 'Save as Script' button on the ComfyUI web interface allows users to export their current workflow as a script.
What is the benefit of using the ComfyUI-SaveAsScript CLI?
The ComfyUI-SaveAsScript CLI allows users to save their script without changing the Python file.
How are arguments passed to the generated script file?
Any time a required input variable for any node in the ComfyUI workflow is left unfilled, SaveAsScript will automatically convert that node into an argument.
What is the purpose of the '--' indicator when passing arguments to ComfyUI?
The '--' indicator is used to indicate that you're done with SaS arguments and are now passing ComfyUI arguments.
What bug fixes have been made in ComfyUI-SaveAsScript?
ComfyUI-SaveAsScript has fixed bugs related to Windows paths being properly escaped and exporting certain Crystools nodes.
